text: To determine the contributions of various regions of the core protein and NS3 protein to infectivity diagnosis , clones of the core gene and different NS3 segments were expressed in E . coli cells and the recombinant proteins were used to test human anti - HCV - positive sera in the ELISA and the rapid lateral flow test strip . The data suggested that the full - length core protein and the new NS3 protein ( 1183 - 1476 aa ) were suitable for analyzing the presence of antibodies against individual HCV proteins in human sera obtained from patients suffering from chronic HCV infection . These results are in agreement with those of previous studies in which the putative nucleocapsid protein ( C ) and non - structural proteins ( NS3 ) were found to contain the most immunodominant epitopes ( 15 ) ( 16 ) ( 17 ) ( 18 ) ( 19 ) .
